Xii. IS δεσπόζων ἰσχύος ἐν ἐπιεικείᾳ κρίνεις, Philo M. 2. p. 112 (Of God) διὰ τὴν σύμφυτον ἐπιείκειαν καὶ φιλανθρωπίαν. It is the Greek equivalent to the Roman clementia (App. BC. ii. 106). The history of the word shows that it is etymologieally connected with εἰκός, implying that which is fit and reasonable 3 but its later meaning was influenoed by the idea of a connexion with εἵκω ‘ to yield‚' implying one who does not stand on his rights, but is ready to give way to the wishes of others.
